str2: And, both. A primary particle of connection or addition; both or also.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To turn back, return. From hupo and strepho; to turn under, i.e. To return.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To sit, be seated, enthroned; I dwell, reside. From kata; and hemai; to sit down; figuratively, to remain, reside.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A chariot, vehicle. Probably from airo (as a particle of union) prefixed); a chariot (compare harmos).

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To read, know again, know certainly, recognize, discern. From ana and ginosko; to know again, i.e. to read.
Isaiah, the prophet. Of Hebrew origin; Hesaias, an Israelite.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a compound of pro and phemi; a foreteller; by analogy, an inspired speaker; by extension, a poet.
